feed.title: Track Awesome Honeypots Updates Weekly
feed.subtitle: an awesome list of honeypot resources

entry.title: Awesome Honeypots Updates on Jul 10 - Jul 16, 2023
entry.content:
Honeypots

  • Service Honeypots
    • ADBHoney (‚≠ê168) - Low interaction honeypot that simulates an Android device running Android Debug Bridge (ADB) server process.
    • AMTHoneypot - Honeypot for Intel's AMT Firmware Vulnerability CVE-2017-5689.
    • ddospot (‚≠ê58) - NTP, DNS, SSDP, Chargen and generic UDP-based amplification DDoS honeypot.
    • dionaea (‚≠ê755) - Home of the dionaea honeypot.
    • dhp (‚≠ê30) - Simple Docker Honeypot server emulating small snippets of the Docker HTTP API.
    • DolosHoneypot (‚≠ê3) - SDN (software defined networking) honeypot.
    • Ensnare (‚≠ê66) - Easy to deploy Ruby honeypot.
    • GenAIPot - The first A.I based open source honeypot. supports POP3 and SMTP protocols and generates content using A.I based on user description.
    • Helix (‚≠ê40) - K8s API Honeypot with Active Defense Capabilities.
    • honeycomb_plugins (‚≠ê26) - Plugin repository for Honeycomb, the honeypot framework by Cymmetria.
    • [honeydb] (https://honeydb.io/downloads) - Multi-service honeypot that is easy to deploy and configure. Can be configured to send interaction data to to HoneyDB's centralized collectors for access via REST API.
    • honeyntp (‚≠ê53) - NTP logger/honeypot.
    • honeypot-camera (‚≠ê50) - Observation camera honeypot.
    • honeypot-ftp (‚≠ê32) - FTP Honeypot.
    • honeypots (‚≠ê799) - 25 different honeypots in a single pypi package! (dns, ftp, httpproxy, http, https, imap, mysql, pop3, postgres, redis, smb, smtp, socks5, ssh, telnet, vnc, mssql, elastic, ldap, ntp, memcache, snmp, oracle, sip and irc).
    • honeytrap (‚≠ê1.3k) - Advanced Honeypot framework written in Go that can be connected with other honeypot software.
    • HoneyPy (‚≠ê468) - Low interaction honeypot.
    • Honeygrove (‚≠ê19) - Multi-purpose modular honeypot based on Twisted.
    • Honeyport (‚≠ê44) - Simple honeyport written in Bash and Python.
    • Honeyprint (‚≠ê20) - Printer honeypot.
    • Lyrebird - Modern high-interaction honeypot framework.
    • MICROS honeypot (‚≠ê16) - Low interaction honeypot to detect CVE-2018-2636 in the Oracle Hospitality Simphony component of Oracle Hospitality Applications (MICROS).
    • node-ftp-honeypot (‚≠ê5) - FTP server honeypot in JS.
    • pyrdp (‚≠ê1.7k) - RDP man-in-the-middle and library for Python 3 with the ability to watch connections live or after the fact.
    • rdppot (‚≠ê67) - RDP honeypot
    • RDPy (‚≠ê1.7k) - Microsoft Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) honeypot implemented in Python.
    • SMB Honeypot (‚≠ê49) - High interaction SMB service honeypot capable of capturing wannacry-like Malware.
    • Tom's Honeypot (‚≠ê26) - Low interaction Python honeypot.
    • Trapster Commmunity (‚≠ê125) - Modural and easy to install Python Honeypot, with comprehensive alerting
    • troje (‚≠ê44) - Honeypot that runs each connection with the service within a separate LXC container.
    • WebLogic honeypot (‚≠ê32) - Low interaction honeypot to detect CVE-2017-10271 in the Oracle WebLogic Server component of Oracle Fusion Middleware.
    • WhiteFace Honeypot (‚≠ê5) - Twisted based honeypot for WhiteFace.
entry.summary: 1 awesome projects updated on Jul 10 - Jul 16, 2023

entry.title: Awesome Honeypots Updates on Oct 24 - Oct 30, 2022
entry.content:
Honeypots

  • Web honeypots

    • Cloud Active Defense (‚≠ê93) - Cloud active defense lets you deploy decoys right into your cloud applications, putting adversaries into a dilemma: to hack or not to hack?
    • Express honeypot (‚≠ê19) - RFI & LFI honeypot using nodeJS and express.
    • EoHoneypotBundle (‚≠ê36) - Honeypot type for Symfony2 forms.
    • Glastopf (‚≠ê578) - Web Application Honeypot.
    • Google Hack Honeypot - Designed to provide reconnaissance against attackers that use search engines as a hacking tool against your resources.
    • HellPot (‚≠ê1.1k) - Honeypot that tries to crash the bots and clients that visit it's location.
    • Laravel Application Honeypot (‚≠ê435) - Simple spam prevention package for Laravel applications.
    • Lophiid (‚≠ê15) - Distributed web application honeypot to interact with large scale exploitation attempts.
    • Nodepot (‚≠ê46) - NodeJS web application honeypot.
    • PasitheaHoneypot (‚≠ê2) - RestAPI honeypot.
    • Servletpot (‚≠ê14) - Web application Honeypot.
    • Shadow Daemon - Modular Web Application Firewall / High-Interaction Honeypot for PHP, Perl, and Python apps.
    • StrutsHoneypot (‚≠ê71) - Struts Apache 2 based honeypot as well as a detection module for Apache 2 servers.
    • WebTrap (‚≠ê65) - Designed to create deceptive webpages to deceive and redirect attackers away from real websites.
    • basic-auth-pot (bap) (‚≠ê50) - HTTP Basic Authentication honeypot.
    • bwpot (‚≠ê27) - Breakable Web applications honeyPot.
    • django-admin-honeypot (‚≠ê1.1k) - Fake Django admin login screen to notify admins of attempted unauthorized access.
    • drupo (‚≠ê57) - Drupal Honeypot.
    • galah (‚≠ê552) - an LLM-powered web honeypot using the OpenAI API.
    • honeyhttpd (‚≠ê50) - Python-based web server honeypot builder.
    • honeyup (‚≠ê28) - An uploader honeypot designed to look like poor website security.
    • modpot (‚≠ê58) - Modpot is a modular web application honeypot framework and management application written in Golang and making use of gin framework.
    • owa-honeypot (‚≠ê67) - A basic flask based Outlook Web Honey pot.
    • phpmyadmin_honeypot (‚≠ê67) - Simple and effective phpMyAdmin honeypot.
    • shockpot - WebApp Honeypot for detecting Shell Shock exploit attempts.
    • smart-honeypot (‚≠ê17) - PHP Script demonstrating a smart honey pot.
    • Snare/Tanner - successors to Glastopf
      • Snare (‚≠ê465) - Super Next generation Advanced Reactive honeypot.
      • Tanner (‚≠ê228) - Evaluating SNARE events.
    • stack-honeypot (‚≠ê23) - Inserts a trap for spam bots into responses.
    • tomcat-manager-honeypot (‚≠ê11) - Honeypot that mimics Tomcat manager endpoints. Logs requests and saves attacker's WAR file for later study.
    • WordPress honeypots
      • HonnyPotter (‚≠ê34) - WordPress login honeypot for collection and analysis of failed login attempts.
      • HoneyPress (‚≠ê7) - Python based WordPress honeypot in a Docker container.
      • wp-smart-honeypot (‚≠ê28) - WordPress plugin to reduce comment spam with a smarter honeypot.
      • wordpot (‚≠ê183) - WordPress Honeypot.
    • Python-Honeypot (‚≠ê464) - OWASP Honeypot, Automated Deception Framework.
entry.summary: 1 awesome projects updated on Oct 24 - Oct 30, 2022

entry.title: Awesome Honeypots Updates on Aug 22 - Aug 28, 2022
entry.content:
Honeypots

  • Database Honeypots

    • Delilah (‚≠ê23) - Elasticsearch Honeypot written in Python (originally from Novetta).
    • ESPot (‚≠ê27) - Elasticsearch honeypot written in NodeJS, to capture every attempts to exploit CVE-2014-3120.
    • ElasticPot - An Elasticsearch Honeypot.
    • Elastic honey (‚≠ê187) - Simple Elasticsearch Honeypot.
    • MongoDB-HoneyProxy (‚≠ê92) - MongoDB honeypot proxy.
    • NoSQLpot (‚≠ê102) - Honeypot framework built on a NoSQL-style database.
    • mysql-honeypotd (‚≠ê34) - Low interaction MySQL honeypot written in C.
    • MysqlPot (‚≠ê21) - MySQL honeypot, still very early stage.
    • pghoney (‚≠ê19) - Low-interaction Postgres Honeypot.
    • sticky_elephant (‚≠ê11) - Medium interaction postgresql honeypot.
    • RedisHoneyPot (‚≠ê24) - High Interaction Honeypot Solution for Redis protocol.

  • SIP

    • SentryPeer (‚≠ê197) - Protect your SIP Servers from bad actors.
entry.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Aug 22 - Aug 28, 2022

entry.title: Awesome Honeypots Updates on Aug 08 - Aug 14, 2022
entry.content:
Honeypots

  • Low interaction honeypot

    • Honeyperl - Honeypot software based in Perl with plugins developed for many functions like : wingates, telnet, squid, smtp, etc.
    • T-Pot (‚≠ê8.1k) - All in one honeypot appliance from telecom provider T-Mobile
    • beelzebub (‚≠ê1.3k) - A secure honeypot framework, extremely easy to configure by yaml üöÄ
entry.summary: 1 awesome projects updated on Aug 08 - Aug 14, 2022

entry.title: Awesome Honeypots Updates on Jan 10 - Jan 16, 2022
entry.content:
Honeypots

  • Distributed Honeypots

    • DemonHunter (‚≠ê62) - Low interaction honeypot server.

  • Anti-honeypot stuff

    • canarytokendetector (‚≠ê22) - Tool for detection and nullification of Thinkst CanaryTokens
    • honeydet (‚≠ê98) - Signature based honeypot detector tool written in Golang
    • kippo_detect (‚≠ê57) - Offensive component that detects the presence of the kippo honeypot.

  • ICS/SCADA honeypots

    • Conpot (‚≠ê1.4k) - ICS/SCADA honeypot.
    • GasPot (‚≠ê140) - Veeder Root Gaurdian AST, common in the oil and gas industry.
    • SCADA honeynet - Building Honeypots for Industrial Networks.
    • gridpot (‚≠ê56) - Open source tools for realistic-behaving electric grid honeynets.
    • scada-honeynet - Mimics many of the services from a popular PLC and better helps SCADA researchers understand potential risks of exposed control system devices.

  • Other/random

    • CitrixHoneypot (‚≠ê116) - Detect and log CVE-2019-19781 scan and exploitation attempts.
    • Damn Simple Honeypot (DSHP) (‚≠ê18) - Honeypot framework with pluggable handlers.
    • dicompot (‚≠ê25) - DICOM Honeypot.
    • IPP Honey - A honeypot for the Internet Printing Protocol.
    • Log4Pot (‚≠ê91) - A honeypot for the Log4Shell vulnerability (CVE-2021-44228).
    • Masscanned (‚≠ê125) - Let's be scanned. A low-interaction honeypot focused on network scanners and bots. It integrates very well with IVRE to build a self-hosted alternative to GreyNoise.
    • medpot (‚≠ê25) - HL7 / FHIR honeypot.
    • NOVA (‚≠ê75) - Uses honeypots as detectors, looks like a complete system.
    • OpenFlow Honeypot (OFPot) (‚≠ê23) - Redirects traffic for unused IPs to a honeypot, built on POX.
    • OpenCanary (‚≠ê2.5k) - Modular and decentralised honeypot daemon that runs several canary versions of services that alerts when a service is (ab)used.
    • ciscoasa_honeypot (‚≠ê52) A low interaction honeypot for the Cisco ASA component capable of detecting CVE-2018-0101, a DoS and remote code execution vulnerability.
    • miniprint (‚≠ê202) - A medium interaction printer honeypot.

  • Botnet C2 tools

    • Hale (‚≠ê193) - Botnet command and control monitor.
    • dnsMole - Analyses DNS traffic and potentionaly detect botnet command and control server activity, along with infected hosts.

  • IPv6 attack detection tool

    • ipv6-attack-detector (‚≠ê40) - Google Summer of Code 2012 project, supported by The Honeynet Project organization.

  • Dynamic code instrumentation toolkit

    • Frida - Inject JavaScript to explore native apps on Windows, Mac, Linux, iOS and Android.

  • Tool to convert website to server honeypots

    • HIHAT - Transform arbitrary PHP applications into web-based high-interaction Honeypots.

  • Malware collector

    • Kippo-Malware - Python script that will download all malicious files stored as URLs in a Kippo SSH honeypot database.

  • Distributed sensor deployment

    • Community Honey Network - CHN aims to make deployments honeypots and honeypot management tools easy and flexible. The default deployment method uses Docker Compose and Docker to deploy with a few simple commands.
    • Modern Honey Network - Multi-snort and honeypot sensor management, uses a network of VMs, small footprint SNORT installations, stealthy dionaeas, and a centralized server for management.

  • Network Analysis Tool

    • Tracexploit - Replay network packets.

  • Log anonymizer

    • LogAnon - Log anonymization library that helps having anonymous logs consistent between logs and network captures.

  • Low interaction honeypot (router back door)

    • Honeypot-32764 (‚≠ê18) - Honeypot for router backdoor (TCP 32764).
    • WAPot (‚≠ê19) - Honeypot that can be used to observe traffic directed at home routers.

  • honeynet farm traffic redirector

    • Honeymole - Deploy multiple sensors that redirect traffic to a centralized collection of honeypots.

  • HTTPS Proxy

    • mitmproxy - Allows traffic flows to be intercepted, inspected, modified, and replayed.

  • System instrumentation

    • Sysdig - Open source, system-level exploration allows one to capture system state and activity from a running GNU/Linux instance, then save, filter, and analyze the results.
    • Fibratus (‚≠ê2.3k) - Tool for exploration and tracing of the Windows kernel.

  • Honeypot for USB-spreading malware

    • Ghost-usb (‚≠ê97) - Honeypot for malware that propagates via USB storage devices.

  • Data Collection

    • Kippo2MySQL - Extracts some very basic stats from Kippo‚Äôs text-based log files and inserts them in a MySQL database.
    • Kippo2ElasticSearch - Python script to transfer data from a Kippo SSH honeypot MySQL database to an ElasticSearch instance (server or cluster).

  • Passive network audit framework parser

    • Passive Network Audit Framework (pnaf) (‚≠ê32) - Framework that combines multiple passive and automated analysis techniques in order to provide a security assessment of network platforms.

  • VM monitoring and tools

    • Antivmdetect (‚≠ê747) - Script to create templates to use with VirtualBox to make VM detection harder.
    • VMCloak (‚≠ê499) - Automated Virtual Machine Generation and Cloaking for Cuckoo Sandbox.
    • vmitools - C library with Python bindings that makes it easy to monitor the low-level details of a running virtual machine.

  • Binary debugger

    • Hexgolems - Pint Debugger Backend (‚≠ê32) - Debugger backend and LUA wrapper for PIN.
    • Hexgolems - Schem Debugger Frontend (‚≠ê141) - Debugger frontend.

  • Mobile Analysis Tool

    • Androguard (‚≠ê5.7k) - Reverse engineering, Malware and goodware analysis of Android applications and more.
    • APKinspector (‚≠ê844) - Powerful GUI tool for analysts to analyze the Android applications.

  • Honeynet data fusion

    • HFlow2 - Data coalesing tool for honeynet/network analysis.

  • Server

    • Amun - Vulnerability emulation honeypot.
    • Artillery (‚≠ê331) - Open-source blue team tool designed to protect Linux and Windows operating systems through multiple methods.
    • Bait and Switch - Redirects all hostile traffic to a honeypot that is partially mirroring your production system.
    • Bifrozt (‚≠ê5) - Automatic deploy bifrozt with ansible.
    • Conpot - Low interactive server side Industrial Control Systems honeypot.
    • Heralding (‚≠ê379) - Credentials catching honeypot.
    • HoneyWRT (‚≠ê21) - Low interaction Python honeypot designed to mimic services or ports that might get targeted by attackers.
    • Honeyd (‚≠ê11) - See honeyd tools.
    • Honeysink - Open source network sinkhole that provides a mechanism for detection and prevention of malicious traffic on a given network.
    • Hontel (‚≠ê161) - Telnet Honeypot.
    • KFSensor - Windows based honeypot Intrusion Detection System (IDS).
    • LaBrea - Takes over unused IP addresses, and creates virtual servers that are attractive to worms, hackers, and other denizens of the Internet.
    • MTPot (‚≠ê104) - Open Source Telnet Honeypot, focused on Mirai malware.
    • SIREN (‚≠ê13) - Semi-Intelligent HoneyPot Network - HoneyNet Intelligent Virtual Environment.
    • TelnetHoney (‚≠ê1) - Simple telnet honeypot.
    • UDPot Honeypot (‚≠ê48) - Simple UDP/DNS honeypot scripts.
    • Yet Another Fake Honeypot (YAFH) (‚≠ê9) - Simple honeypot written in Go.
    • arctic-swallow (‚≠ê2) - Low interaction honeypot.
    • fapro (‚≠ê1.6k) - Fake Protocol Server.
    • glutton (‚≠ê281) - All eating honeypot.
    • go-HoneyPot (‚≠ê46) - Honeypot server written in Go.
    • go-emulators (‚≠ê10) - Honeypot Golang emulators.
    • honeymail (‚≠ê29) - SMTP honeypot written in Golang.
    • honeytrap (‚≠ê94) - Low-interaction honeypot and network security tool written to catch attacks against TCP and UDP services.
    • imap-honey (‚≠ê25) - IMAP honeypot written in Golang.
    • mwcollectd - Versatile malware collection daemon, uniting the best features of nepenthes and honeytrap.
    • potd (‚≠ê30) - Highly scalable low- to medium-interaction SSH/TCP honeypot designed for OpenWrt/IoT devices leveraging several Linux kernel features, such as namespaces, seccomp and thread capabilities.
    • portlurker (‚≠ê34) - Port listener in Rust with protocol guessing and safe string display.
    • slipm-honeypot (‚≠ê17) - Simple low-interaction port monitoring honeypot.
    • telnet-iot-honeypot (‚≠ê306) - Python telnet honeypot for catching botnet binaries.
    • telnetlogger (‚≠ê242) - Telnet honeypot designed to track the Mirai botnet.
    • vnclowpot (‚≠ê22) - Low interaction VNC honeypot.

  • IDS signature generation

    • Honeycomb - Automated signature creation using honeypots.

  • Lookup service for AS-numbers and prefixes

    • CC2ASN - Simple lookup service for AS-numbers and prefixes belonging to any given country in the world.

  • Data Collection / Data Sharing

    • HPfriends - Honeypot data-sharing platform.
      • hpfriends - real-time social data-sharing - Presentation about HPFriends feed system
    • HPFeeds (‚≠ê216) - Lightweight authenticated publish-subscribe protocol.

  • Central management tool

    • PHARM - Manage, report, and analyze your distributed Nepenthes instances.

  • Network connection analyzer

    • Impost - Network security auditing tool designed to analyze the forensics behind compromised and/or vulnerable daemons.

  • Honeypot deployment

    • honeyfs (‚≠ê8) - Tool to create artificial file systems for medium/high interaction honeypots.
    • Modern Honeynet Network - Streamlines deployment and management of secure honeypots.

  • Honeypot extensions to Wireshark

    • Wireshark Extensions - Apply Snort IDS rules and signatures against packet capture files using Wireshark.

  • Client

    • CWSandbox / GFI Sandbox
    • Capture-HPC-Linux
    • Capture-HPC-NG (‚≠ê11)
    • Capture-HPC - High interaction client honeypot (also called honeyclient).
    • HoneyBOT
    • HoneyC
    • HoneySpider Network (‚≠ê29) - Highly-scalable system integrating multiple client honeypots to detect malicious websites.
    • HoneyWeb - Web interface created to manage and remotely share Honeyclients resources.
    • Jsunpack-n (‚≠ê165)
    • MonkeySpider
    • PhoneyC (‚≠ê26) - Python honeyclient (later replaced by Thug).
    • Pwnypot - High Interaction Client Honeypot.
    • Rumal - Thug's RumƒÅl: a Thug's dress and weapon.
    • Shelia - Client-side honeypot for attack detection.
    • Thug - Python-based low-interaction honeyclient.
    • Thug Distributed Task Queuing
    • Trigona
    • URLQuery
    • YALIH (Yet Another Low Interaction Honeyclient) (‚≠ê68) - Low-interaction client honeypot designed to detect malicious websites through signature, anomaly, and pattern matching techniques.

  • Honeypot

    • Deception Toolkit
    • IMHoneypot (‚≠ê16)

  • PDF document inspector

    • peepdf (‚≠ê1.4k) - Powerful Python tool to analyze PDF documents.

  • Hybrid low/high interaction honeypot

    • HoneyBrid

  • SSH Honeypots

    • Blacknet (‚≠ê21) - Multi-head SSH honeypot system.
    • Cowrie (‚≠ê5.7k) - Cowrie SSH Honeypot (based on kippo).
    • DShield docker (‚≠ê15) - Docker container running cowrie with DShield output enabled.
    • endlessh (‚≠ê8k) - SSH tarpit that slowly sends an endless banner. (docker image)
    • HonSSH (‚≠ê375) - Logs all SSH communications between a client and server.
    • HUDINX (‚≠ê6) - Tiny interaction SSH honeypot engineered in Python to log brute force attacks and, most importantly, the entire shell interaction performed by the attacker.
    • Kippo (‚≠ê1.7k) - Medium interaction SSH honeypot.
    • Kippo_JunOS (‚≠ê10) - Kippo configured to be a backdoored netscreen.
    • Kojoney2 (‚≠ê38) - Low interaction SSH honeypot written in Python and based on Kojoney by Jose Antonio Coret.
    • Kojoney - Python-based Low interaction honeypot that emulates an SSH server implemented with Twisted Conch.
    • Longitudinal Analysis of SSH Cowrie Honeypot Logs (‚≠ê18) - Python based command line tool to analyze cowrie logs over time.
    • LongTail Log Analysis @ Marist College - Analyzed SSH honeypot logs.
    • Malbait (‚≠ê8) - Simple TCP/UDP honeypot implemented in Perl.
    • MockSSH (‚≠ê128) - Mock an SSH server and define all commands it supports (Python, Twisted).
    • cowrie2neo (‚≠ê7) - Parse cowrie honeypot logs into a neo4j database.
    • go-sshoney (‚≠ê33) - SSH Honeypot.
    • go0r (‚≠ê36) - Simple ssh honeypot in Golang.
    • gohoney (‚≠ê12) - SSH honeypot written in Go.
    • hived (‚≠ê3) - Golang-based honeypot.
    • hnypots-agent) (‚≠ê37) - SSH Server in Go that logs username and password combinations.
    • honeypot.go (‚≠ê29) - SSH Honeypot written in Go.
    • honeyssh (‚≠ê12) - Credential dumping SSH honeypot with statistics.
    • hornet (‚≠ê23) - Medium interaction SSH honeypot that supports multiple virtual hosts.
    • ssh-auth-logger (‚≠ê22) - Low/zero interaction SSH authentication logging honeypot.
    • ssh-honeypot (‚≠ê653) - Fake sshd that logs IP addresses, usernames, and passwords.
    • ssh-honeypot (‚≠ê26) - Modified version of the OpenSSH deamon that forwards commands to Cowrie where all commands are interpreted and returned.
    • ssh-honeypotd (‚≠ê17) - Low-interaction SSH honeypot written in C.
    • sshForShits (‚≠ê38) - Framework for a high interaction SSH honeypot.
    • sshesame (‚≠ê1.7k) - Fake SSH server that lets everyone in and logs their activity.
    • sshhipot (‚≠ê169) - High-interaction MitM SSH honeypot.
    • sshlowpot (‚≠ê15) - Yet another no-frills low-interaction SSH honeypot in Go.
    • sshsyrup (‚≠ê98) - Simple SSH Honeypot with features to capture terminal activity and upload to asciinema.org.
    • twisted-honeypots (‚≠ê86) - SSH, FTP and Telnet honeypots based on Twisted.

  • Distributed sensor project

    • DShield Web Honeypot Project

  • A pcap analyzer

    • Honeysnap

  • Network traffic redirector

    • Honeywall

  • Honeypot Distribution with mixed content

    • HoneyDrive

  • Honeypot sensor

    • Honeeepi - Honeypot sensor on a Raspberry Pi based on a customized Raspbian OS.

  • File carving

    • TestDisk & PhotoRec

  • Behavioral analysis tool for win32

    • Capture BAT

  • Live CD

    • DAVIX - The DAVIX Live CD.

  • Spamtrap

    • Mail::SMTP::Honeypot - Perl module that appears to provide the functionality of a standard SMTP server.
    • Mailoney (‚≠ê266) - SMTP honeypot written in python.
    • SendMeSpamIDS.py (‚≠ê12) - Simple SMTP fetch all IDS and analyzer.
    • Shiva (‚≠ê138) - Spam Honeypot with Intelligent Virtual Analyzer.
      • Shiva The Spam Honeypot Tips And Tricks For Getting It Up And Running
    • SMTPLLMPot (‚≠ê6) - A super simple SMTP Honeypot built using GPT3.5
    • SpamHAT (‚≠ê26) - Spam Honeypot Tool.
    • Spamhole
    • honeypot (‚≠ê2) - The Project Honey Pot un-official PHP SDK.
    • spamd

  • Commercial honeynet

    • Cymmetria Mazerunner - Leads attackers away from real targets and creates a footprint of the attack.

  • Server (Bluetooth)

    • Bluepot (‚≠ê258)

  • Dynamic analysis of Android apps

    • Droidbox

  • Dockerized Low Interaction packaging

    • Docker honeynet (‚≠ê22) - Several Honeynet tools set up for Docker containers.
    • Dockerized Thug - Dockerized Thug (‚≠ê1k) to analyze malicious web content.
    • Dockerpot (‚≠ê150) - Docker based honeypot.
    • Manuka (‚≠ê24) - Docker based honeypot (Dionaea and Kippo).
    • honey_ports (‚≠ê7) - Very simple but effective docker deployed honeypot to detect port scanning in your environment.
    • mhn-core-docker (‚≠ê34) - Core elements of the Modern Honey Network implemented in Docker.

  • Network analysis

    • Quechua

  • SIP Server

    • Artemnesia VoIP

  • IOT Honeypot

    • HoneyThing (‚≠ê123) - TR-069 Honeypot.
    • Kako (‚≠ê27) - Honeypots for a number of well known and deployed embedded device vulnerabilities.
  • Honeytokens
    • CanaryTokens (‚≠ê1.9k) - Self-hostable honeytoken generator and reporting dashboard; demo version available at CanaryTokens.org.
    • Honeybits (‚≠ê272) - Simple tool designed to enhance the effectiveness of your traps by spreading breadcrumbs and honeytokens across your production servers and workstations to lure the attacker toward your honeypots.
    • HoneyŒª (HoneyLambda) (‚≠ê517) - Simple, serverless application designed to create and monitor URL honeytokens, on top of AWS Lambda and Amazon API Gateway.
    • dcept (‚≠ê507) - Tool for deploying and detecting use of Active Directory honeytokens.
    • honeyku (‚≠ê64) - Heroku-based web honeypot that can be used to create and monitor fake HTTP endpoints (i.e. honeytokens).

Honeyd Tools

  • Honeyd plugin

    • Honeycomb

  • Honeyd viewer

    • Honeyview

  • Honeyd to MySQL connector

    • Honeyd2MySQL

  • A script to visualize statistics from honeyd

    • Honeyd-Viz
  • Honeyd stats
    • Honeydsum.pl (‚≠ê372)

Network and Artifact Analysis

  • Sandbox

    • Argos - Emulator for capturing zero-day attacks.
    • COMODO automated sandbox
    • Cuckoo - Leading open source automated malware analysis system.
    • Pylibemu (‚≠ê126) - Libemu Cython wrapper.
    • RFISandbox - PHP 5.x script sandbox built on top of funcall.
    • dorothy2 (‚≠ê196) - Malware/botnet analysis framework written in Ruby.
    • imalse (‚≠ê13) - Integrated MALware Simulator and Emulator.
    • libemu (‚≠ê152) - Shellcode emulation library, useful for shellcode detection.

  • Sandbox-as-a-Service

    • Hybrid Analysis - Free malware analysis service powered by Payload Security that detects and analyzes unknown threats using a unique Hybrid Analysis technology.
    • Joebox Cloud - Analyzes the behavior of malicious files including PEs, PDFs, DOCs, PPTs, XLSs, APKs, URLs and MachOs on Windows, Android and Mac OS X for suspicious activities.
    • VirusTotal - Analyze suspicious files and URLs to detect types of malware, and automatically share them with the security community.
    • malwr.com - Free malware analysis service and community.

Data Tools

  • Front Ends

    • DionaeaFR (‚≠ê67) - Front Web to Dionaea low-interaction honeypot.
    • Django-kippo (‚≠ê12) - Django App for kippo SSH Honeypot.
    • Shockpot-Frontend (‚≠ê3) - Full featured script to visualize statistics from a Shockpot honeypot.
    • Tango (‚≠ê254) - Honeypot Intelligence with Splunk.
    • Wordpot-Frontend (‚≠ê5) - Full featured script to visualize statistics from a Wordpot honeypot.
    • honeyalarmg2 (‚≠ê4) - Simplified UI for showing honeypot alarms.
    • honeypotDisplay (‚≠ê3) - Flask website which displays data gathered from an SSH Honeypot.

  • Visualization

    • Acapulco (‚≠ê10) - Automated Attack Community Graph Construction.
    • Afterglow Cloud (‚≠ê15)
    • Afterglow
    • Glastopf Analytics (‚≠ê3) - Easy honeypot statistics.
    • HoneyMalt (‚≠ê14) - Maltego tranforms for mapping Honeypot systems.
    • HoneyMap (‚≠ê220) - Real-time websocket stream of GPS events on a fancy SVG world map.
    • HoneyStats - Statistical view of the recorded activity on a Honeynet.
    • HpfeedsHoneyGraph (‚≠ê15) - Visualization app to visualize hpfeeds logs.
    • IVRE (‚≠ê3.8k) - Network recon framework, published by @cea-sec & @ANSSI-FR. Build your own, self-hosted and fully-controlled alternatives to Criminalip / Shodan / ZoomEye / Censys and GreyNoise, run your Passive DNS service, collect and analyse network intelligence from your sensors, and much more!
    • Kippo stats (‚≠ê18) - Mojolicious app to display statistics for your kippo SSH honeypot.
    • Kippo-Graph - Full featured script to visualize statistics from a Kippo SSH honeypot.
    • The Intelligent HoneyNet (‚≠ê62) - Create actionable information from honeypots.
    • ovizart (‚≠ê47) - Visual analysis for network traffic.

Guides

  • Deployment

    • Dionaea and EC2 in 20 Minutes - Tutorial on setting up Dionaea on an EC2 instance.
    • Using a Raspberry Pi honeypot to contribute data to DShield/ISC - The Raspberry Pi based system will allow us to maintain one code base that will make it easier to collect rich logs beyond firewall logs.
    • honeypotpi (‚≠ê34) - Script for turning a Raspberry Pi into a HoneyPot Pi.

  • Research Papers

    • Honeypot research papers (‚≠ê32) - PDFs of research papers on honeypots.
    • vEYE - Behavioral footprinting for self-propagating worm detection and profiling.
entry.summary: 64 awesome projects updated on Jan 10 - Jan 16, 2022

  • awesome-malware-analysis (‚≠ê13k) - Some overlap here for artifact analysis.
